text: (March 14, 2007) Vice Chairman Lipinski Promotes American Competitiveness
label: TITLE

text: Agenda
label: BODY

text: Vice Chairman Lipinski Promotes American Competitiveness Agenda
label: BODY

text: Helps Unveil "American Innovation Proclamation"
label: BODY

text: WASHINGTON, DC - Yesterday, House Science and Technology Committee Vice Chair Dan Lipinski joined Committee
label: BODY

text: Chairman Bart Gordon, leaders from industry and higher education, and a bipartisan group of House and Senate
label: BODY

text: members to unveil the American Innovation Proclamation.  Signed by more than 270 leaders representing American
label: BODY

text: businesses and higher education, the proclamation emphasizes strong support for legislative efforts to adopt an
label: BODY

text: innovation agenda that will ensure U.S. competitiveness and enable Americans to succeed in the global economy.
label: BODY

text: The proclamation includes calls for Congress to renew America's commitment to discovery by doubling federal basic
label: BODY

text: research funding, to improve student achievement in math and science by providing incentives for teachers and funding
label: BODY

text: proven programs, and to encourage private-sector innovation investment by strengthening the research and
label: BODY

text: development tax credit.  The document was unveiled by Harold McGraw III, Chairman and President of The McGraw Hill
label: BODY

text: Companies, Norman Augustine, Former Chairman and CEO of Lockheed Martin Corporation, and Robert Dynes,
label: BODY

text: President of the University of California.
label: BODY

text: "As an engineer and a former educator I understand that the keys to America's economic future are education and
label: BODY

text: technological innovation," said Lipinski.  "The proposals called for in this proclamation would ensure that America is
label: BODY

text: prepared to meet the challenge of an increasingly global economy and I thank our business and education leaders for
label: BODY

text: pressing Congress to meet this great challenge of our time."
label: BODY

text: Last Congress, Lipinski and colleagues on the Science Committee led the House in introducing an innovation package of
label: BODY

text: legislation built upon the recommendations of the widely acknowledged Rising Above the Gathering Storm report issued
label: BODY

text: by the National Academy of Sciences.  That innovation package in the 110th Congress includes H.R. 362 and H.R. 363,
label: BODY

text: both cosponsored by Congressman Lipinski.  The "10,000 Teachers, 10 Million Minds Science and Math Scholarship Act"
label: BODY

text: (H.R. 362) seeks to establish a program to provide scholarships to students who commit to become science or math
label: BODY

text: teachers at public elementary and secondary schools.  The "Sowing the Seeds Through Science and Engineering
label: BODY

text: Research Act" (H.R. 363) seeks to double funding for basic research in the physical sciences in seven years and invest a
label: BODY

text: Congressman Daniel Lipinski
label: BODY

text: http://www.lipinski.house.gov
label: BODY

label: BODY

text: Generated: 26 February, 2009, 10:45
label: BODY

text: portion of such funds to support high-risk, high-payoff research.
label: BODY

text: In addition to these bills, the House of Representatives earlier this week passed Congressman Dan Lipinski's bill to
label: BODY

text: reauthorize the Steel and Aluminum Energy Conservation and Technology Competitiveness Act of 1988.  H.R. 1126,
label: BODY

text: known as the Metals Initiative, provides research funding to make the manufacturing of American steel and other metals
label: BODY

text: more efficient and environmentally friendly.  As a result of this legislation, American metals industries will get help
label: BODY

text: developing and implementing cost-saving and environmentally-friendly modern technology through critical grants to
label: BODY

text: universities and other research institutions.
label: BODY
